The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Lock
member.summary: Provides a way to get mutual exclusion in regions of code between different threads. A lock may be held by one thread at a time.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Lock.Enter
member.summary: Enters the lock. Once the method returns, the calling thread would be the only thread that holds the lock.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Lock.TryEnter
member.summary: Tries to enter the lock without waiting. If the lock is entered, the calling thread would be the only thread that holds the lock.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Lock.TryEnter(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Tries to enter the lock, waiting for roughly the specified duration. If the lock is entered, the calling thread would be the only thread that holds the lock.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Lock.TryEnter(System.Int32)
member.summary: Tries to enter the lock, waiting for roughly the specified duration. If the lock is entered, the calling thread would be the only thread that holds the lock.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Lock.Exit
member.summary: Exits the lock.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Lock.EnterScope
member.summary: Enters the lock and returns a that may be disposed to exit the lock. Once the method returns, the calling thread would be the only thread that holds the lock. This method is intended to be used along with a language construct that would automatically dispose the , such as with the C# using statement.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Lock.Scope
member.summary: A disposable structure that is returned by , which when disposed, exits the lock.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Lock.Scope.#ctor(System.Threading.Lock)
member.summary: A disposable structure that is returned by , which when disposed, exits the lock.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Lock.Scope.Dispose
member.summary: Exits the lock.
